definition: sour/tart/sick at heart/grieved/sore/aching/pedantic/impractical/to make sarcastic remarks about sb/an acid

sentences.english: She would have preferred the humble cart.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎寧肯坐那輛簡陋寒酸的馬車。

sentences.english: we realize people won't like us for nattering on meanly about others.
sentences.chinese: 我們意識到人們會因爲寒酸地談論別人而不喜歡我們。

sentences.english: She hated dinginess as much as her mother had hated it.
sentences.chinese: 她同母親一樣，對貧困寒酸的日子深惡痛絕。

sentences.english: Pride breakfasted with Plenty, dined with Poverty, and supped with Infamy .
sentences.chinese: 驕者往往早餐豐盛，午餐寒酸，晚餐時聲名狼藉。

sentences.english: Today is lodged at a friends house the shabby hourly workers.
sentences.chinese: 如今是寄住在朋友家的寒酸小時工。

sentences.english: Though poorly-dressed, the old man was healthy and ruddy-faced.
sentences.chinese: 這位老先生儘管穿得寒酸，但身體健康，臉色紅潤。

sentences.english: Round the little harbour were shabby streets in which lived fishermen and poor people.
sentences.chinese: 小碼頭一帶都是寒酸凋敝的小巷，住着漁民和窮人。

definition: variant of 寒磣|寒碜[han2 chen5]
not presentable/shoddy and too embarrassing to show
ostentation/a show of extravagance/grand style/red tape
